Families this is a tough pill to swallow, especially the last column, and we don't like it any more than you do. Our teachers are working with families and students who have been placed on quarantine to ensure their education continues while they are at home.
You may wonder how wearing face coverings plays into these scenarios. If a student tests positive, anyone in close contact (less than 6 ft. for 15 minutes or more) will be placed on quarantine whether or not face coverings have been used. Wearing face coverings prevents us from having to quarantine a much larger group, such as the entire class. We appreciate the partnership between our staff and families as we continue adapting to these challenges. #tigersstrongertogether

Our summer workout program for incoming 8th-12th grade athletes begins Monday! The safety of our students and staff is our top priority. Here are our safety and cleaning guidelines for the workout program. We will be sending our summer school safety guidelines to parents next week.
Weight Rooms and Fitness rooms will have multiple hand sanitizer dispensers.
Microfiber cleaning cloths will be available, as well as EPA registered disinfectants to wipe down all equipment between uses.
At the end of each session, the instructor will spray down all commonly touched surfaces with a Protexus Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprayer.
At the end of each day, custodial staff will spray down all surfaces with a Protexus Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprayer and launder all used microfiber cleaning cloths.

Students from Mrs. Lurvey's science classes at Ozark West Elementary School K-5 spent the morning showcasing their learning from Project Lead the Way Launch Science Curriculum.
Kindergarteners demonstrated moving rocks through a push and pull system.
First graders explained animal adaptations such as different bird beaks and camouflage.
Second graders created and tested an erosion prevention plan for landslides.
Third graders demonstrated dominant and recessive genes.
Fourth graders designed a restraint system to keep an egg from cracking during a collision.
Fifth graders explained inputs and outputs within a robotics testbed.

post_text: What better way to learn about the criminal justice system than holding a mock trial? First graders at South Elementary put Goldilocks on trial today for robbing the three bears. She was charged with trespassing, breaking and entering, and destruction of property. Their Ozark Chamber of Commerce Adopt-A-Class partner, Bruce Galloway Law Office, LLC, taught students how a trial works with help from the Ozark Police Department - Ozark, Missouri. Who knows, maybe the trial inspired some of these students to consider becoming a lawyer, a law enforcement officer or a judge! And in case you were wondering, the jury of first graders found Goldilocks guilty and sent her to jail in handcuffs.
